Supplying marine consumables, products, and solutions to every conceivable vessel type, our Marine Products division includes the Unitor brand of products, Timm ropes, Unicool refrigerants, and Unitor and Nalfleet marine chemicals. Fluent in English – both in writing and speaking

Advise and support customers on what to buy, where to buy, why to buy and how to buy from WSS MP through good commercial and technical guidance.

Customer Coordinator (Global Agent, Customer Service Department)


Founded in Norway in 1861, Wilhelmsen is now a comprehensive global maritime group providing over half of the merchant fleet with essential products and services, along with supplying crew and technical management to the largest and most complex vessels ever to sail. Committed to shaping the maritime industry, we also seek to explore and develop new opportunities within the renewables, offshore and energy industries. Supporting a diverse and inclusive workplace, with thousands of colleagues in more than 70 countries, we take competence, sustainability, innovation, and unparalleled customer experiences one step further.

We are looking for a Global Agent to join our Ships Agency division.

In Ships Agency, we provide our customers with piece of mind while we handle their cargo, their vessels and their crew. We handle 75,000 port calls per year, which means that every 7 minutes, anywhere around the world, we send a ship safely out to sea again to fulfil its purpose. We match local expertise with strict global standards, making sure we consistently make our customers’ port calls as efficient and safe as possible.

Job Description

Main Responsibilities

Manage existing contracts for Ships Agency customers.
Collaborate with WSS local agents globally on port call pre-planning and cost estimates, understand customer needs and communicate to local port agents that provide the agency services.
Work closely with operational and administration teams to secure all requirements from the customer in accordance with global operational standards and contract terms in place with customers.
Handle customer complaints and follow up on solutions.
Collaborate with Sales Managers and Credit team on customer outstanding settlements.
Support Sales Managers on business development and business reviews.
Filter potential business opportunities and pass it on to relevant parties in the network.
Suggest process improvements based on efficiency, productivity, or cost effectiveness.
Support the Global Agent network as a team.
Handle any ad-hoc assignments from the Supervisor/Manager.

Accountabilities 

This position will be measured against:

Number of port calls handled and average agency fee values.
Adherence of DAs to agreed agency fees and service scope.
Number of leads and opportunities passed to Sales Managers.
Number of customer compliments and complaints.
Compliance to all applicable processes. 

Qualifications 

Degree holders, min. 3 years working experience in any field, experience in shipping industry will be an advantage.
Self-motivated and Customer-oriented with commercial mind.
Organized and logically thinking, good problem solution skills.
Enjoy working in dynamic environment with changing requirements and pressure, excellent time management to commit service deadlines.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, able to work with people from different cultural backgrounds, both internally and externally.
Proficient in written and spoken English & Chinese, including Mandarin.
Computer literate.

Good negotiating skills.
Good networking and relation building skills.

description:
Global Agent HK (Ships Agency, Customer Service Department)



Founded in Norway in 1861, Wilhelmsen is now a comprehensive global maritime group providing over half of the merchant fleet with essential products and services, along with supplying crew and technical management to the largest and most complex vessels ever to sail. Committed to shaping the maritime industry, we also seek to explore and develop new opportunities within the renewables, offshore and energy industries. Supporting a diverse and inclusive workplace, with thousands of colleagues in more than 70 countries, we take competence, sustainability, innovation, and unparalleled customer experiences one step further.


We are looking for a Global Agent to join our Ships Agency division.

In Ships Agency, we provide our customers with piece of mind while we handle their cargo, their vessels and their crew. We handle 75,000 port calls per year, which means that every 7 minutes, anywhere around the world, we send a ship safely out to sea again to fulfil its purpose. We match local expertise with strict global standards, making sure we consistently make our customers’ port calls as efficient and safe as possible.


Job Description

Main Responsibilities

Manage existing contracts for Ships Agency customers.
Collaborate with WSS local agents globally on port call pre-planning and cost estimates, understand customer needs and communicate to local port agents that provide the agency services.
Work closely with operational and administration teams to secure all requirements from the customer in accordance with global operational standards and contract terms in place with customers.
Handle customer complaints and follow up on solutions.
Collaborate with Sales Managers and Credit team on customer outstanding settlements.
Support Sales Managers on business development and business reviews.
Filter potential business opportunities and pass it on to relevant parties in the network.
Suggest process improvements based on efficiency, productivity, or cost effectiveness.
Support the Global Agent network as a team.
Handle any ad-hoc assignments from the Supervisor/Manager.

Accountabilities 

This position will be measured against:

Number of port calls handled and average agency fee values.
Adherence of DAs to agreed agency fees and service scope.
Number of leads and opportunities passed to Sales Managers.
Number of customer compliments and complaints.
Compliance to all applicable processes. 

Qualifications 

Degree holders, min. 3 years working experience in any field, experience in shipping industry will be an advantage.
Self-motivated and Customer-oriented with commercial mind.
Organized and logically thinking, good problem solution skills.
Enjoy working in dynamic environment with changing requirements and pressure, excellent time management to commit service deadlines.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, able to work with people from different cultural backgrounds, both internally and externally.
Proficient in written and spoken English & Chinese, including Mandarin.
Computer literate.

Additional Preferences 

Good negotiating skills.
Good networking and relation building skills.

Sounds interesting? If you can see yourself in this role, please let us know why you are our new Global Agent.


You can apply online today through our career portal by creating a ‘Candidate Home’ account. Here you can upload your resume and a motivational letter.

www.wilhelmsen.com

Application Deadline: 7 January 2022
